instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl and season with salt and black pepper.
Beat until the mixture becomes smooth and slightly frothy.
Heat a non-stick pan over low heat and add a small amount of oil.
Pour the beaten eggs into the pan and gently move the pan to spread evenly.
tips: Low heat is essential to maintain a soft, custard-like texture.
Gently swirl or stir while cooking to avoid over-setting the bottom.

instructions: Dice bell peppers and bacon or ham into small, even pieces.
Add a small amount of butter to a separate pan over medium heat.
Sauté the filling ingredients until lightly fragrant but not browned.
tips: Avoid overcooking vegetables to preserve texture.
Optional: add finely diced mushrooms for additional umami.

instructions: Check if the omelette surface is softly set but still slightly creamy.
Place the warm filling onto one side of the omelette in a neat line.
tips: Do not wait until the omelette fully sets or folding will crack the surface.

instructions: Use a spatula to gently fold the omelette over the filling.
Turn off heat and allow the omelette to rest for a few seconds.
Transfer to a plate without flipping to preserve the smooth surface.
tips: A classic French omelette should remain pale yellow and moist inside.
Sprinkle fresh herbs or black pepper on top before serving if desired.
